intro: Hygroryza ciliata, commonly known as the silky hygroryza, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, hair-covered stems and narrow, elongated leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spikelets. Hygroryza ciliata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
